Package com.berthoud.oc_project3_gameclasses

Class Games

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berthoud.oc_project3_gameclasses.Games
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Game1, Game2
    public abstract class Games
extends java.lang.Object
    * Abstract class for both games ("Game +/- " and Mastermind) It contains all the instance fields and methods shared by both games

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private boolean codeFound
      is true when the mystery code has been broken by the challenger
      private int[] codeProposal
      This is code attempt made by the player (mode challenger) or the computer (mode defender)
      private int[] codeToBeFound
      This is the mystery code to be found, created by the computer (mode challenger) or by the player (mode defender)
      private int maxGuesses
      max number of guesses allowed
      private int nbDigits
      number of digits
      private int nbGuesses
      counts the number of guesses used by the challenger
      private int nbVariations
      Number of values that each digit can possibly take
      static java.util.Scanner scan
      Object scanner, need for user inputs

      • play

        public abstract void play()
        This method is a wrapper-method that starts and executes the game until the end. All the methods required for the execution of the game are called within this wrapper-method. The implementation is different for each game and mode.

      • randomCodeGenerator

        protected abstract int[] randomCodeGenerator()
        This methods generates a random code made of X digits, X being equal to value of nbDigits
        Returns:
        the random code

      • guessValidationUnit

        protected abstract void guessValidationUnit()
        This method takes a guess and display the validation code (in challenger mode), generates a guess, takes a validation code and generate the next guess (in defender mode)

      • codeInputUser

        protected abstract int[] codeInputUser()
        This method inputs the code entered by the player on the keyboard test its validity and return it
        Returns:
        the valid code entered by the player

      • endingMenu

        void endingMenu()
        This method calls the selection menu at the end of the game.

      • displayModeDev

        void displayModeDev​(int[] codeToBeFound)
        This method displays the instance variable codeToBeFound when the developer mode is activated
        Parameters:
        codeToBeFound - the mystery code

      • messageEndOfTheGame

        protected void messageEndOfTheGame()
        This method displays the result of the game at the end of the game.
